com.orchestranetworks.ui
Interface UIComponentWriter

All Superinterfaces:
UIBodyWriter, UIJavaScriptWriter, UIResourceLocator, UISessionContext
All Known Subinterfaces:
UIAjaxContext, UIFormPaneWriter, UIResponseContext, UIServiceComponentWriter, UITableFilterResponseContext
public interface UIComponentWriter
extends UIBodyWriter, UIJavaScriptWriter, UIResourceLocator, UISessionContext

This interface offers common user interface methods to create standard EBX5 components.

Since:
5.2.0
See Also:
UI Developer Guide

Method Detail

addButtonHelp

public UIComponentWriter addButtonHelp(String aURL)
Displays a button with the help icon.

Clicking on the button displays a help pop-up that opens the target URL.

In a UI service, the context-sensitive help button can be enabled using ServiceContext.setContextSensitiveHelpURL(String).

Parameters:
aURL - the URL for the content of the pop-up.

addButtonJavaScript

public UIComponentWriter addButtonJavaScript(UIButtonSpecJSAction aJavaScriptButtonSpec)
Adds a button for a JavaScript command.

Parameters:
aJavaScriptButtonSpec - a JavaScript button specification.

addButtonJavaScriptToggle

public UIComponentWriter addButtonJavaScriptToggle(UIButtonSpecJSActionToggle aJavaScriptToggleButtonSpec)
Adds a toggle button for two JavaScript commands (toggle ON and toggle OFF).

Parameters:
aJavaScriptToggleButtonSpec - a JavaScript toggle button specification.
Since:
5.2.3

addUILabel

public void addUILabel(UIFormLabelSpec aLabelSpec)
Adds the specified label. It can include additional documentation available in a pop-up.

buildButtonPreview

public UIButtonSpecJSAction buildButtonPreview(String aURL)
Builds a preview button, using the standard "preview" label.

Parameters:
aURL - the URL for the content of the inner pop-up.
See Also:
buildButtonPreview(String, UserMessage)

buildButtonPreview

public UIButtonSpecJSAction buildButtonPreview(String aURL,
                                               UserMessage aLabel)
Builds a preview button with a specified label.

Clicking on the button displays the standard modal inner pop-up with the specified URL. The returned object can be modified and added to the page using the method addButtonJavaScript(UIButtonSpecJSAction).

The button can be modified in different ways, such as setting the button to display only an icon using UIButtonSpec#setButtonLayout (UIButtonLayout.ICON_ONLY).

Recommendations concerning the specified URL:

  • The use of an EBX5 web component is generally recommended.
  • The inner pop-up works with an iFrame, so an external URL may not work.
  • The methods getURLForSelection from the UIResourceLocator should not be used, because the returned URLs change the state of the current session. They must be invoked in the current window only, not in pop-ups.

Parameters:
aURL - the URL of the inner pop-up content.
aLabel - the label of the button.

startBorder

public void startBorder(boolean isColored)
Starts a border. This is equivalent to HTML <fieldset>.

Note: The border must be terminated using endBorder().

Parameters:
isColored - true to have a colored border, false to have a grey border.

startBorder

public void startBorder(boolean isColored,
                        UIFormLabelSpec aLabelSpec)
Starts a border with a caption. This is equivalent to an HTML <fieldset> with a <legend>.

Note: The border must be terminated using endBorder().

Parameters:
isColored - true to have a colored border, false to have a grey border.
aLabelSpec - the border label.

startBorder

public void startBorder(boolean isColored,
                        UserMessage aCaption)
Starts a border with a caption. This is equivalent to an HTML <fieldset> with a <legend>.

Note: The border must be terminated using endBorder().

Parameters:
isColored - true to have a colored border, false to have a gray border.
aCaption - a UserMessage to enable caption.

endBorder

public void endBorder()
Ends the border previously started by a startBorder.

startExpandCollapseBlock

public String startExpandCollapseBlock(UserMessage aCaption,
                                       boolean collapsed)
Starts an expand/collapse block with a caption.

Note: The expand/collapse block must be terminated using endExpandCollapseBlock().

Parameters:
aCaption - the caption of the block (always displayed).
collapsed - true to have the block initially collapsed, false to have the block initially expanded.
Returns:
the unique id of this expand/collapse block, to be used with UIJavaScriptWriter.addJS_setExpandCollapseBlockExpanded(String, String).
Since:
5.2.3

endExpandCollapseBlock

public void endExpandCollapseBlock()
Ends the expand/collapse block started by startExpandCollapseBlock(UserMessage, boolean).

Since:
5.2.3

startFormRow

public void startFormRow(UIFormLabelSpec aLabelSpec)
Starts a form row containing a label and some plain HTML content. It can contain another form row.

Note: The form row must be ended with endFormRow() after creating its HTML content.

Parameters:
aLabelSpec - the row label.
See Also:
UIResponseContext.startFormRow(com.orchestranetworks.schema.Path)

startFormRow

public void startFormRow(UIFormLabelSpec aLabelSpec,
                         String anIconURL)
Starts a form row containing an icon, a label and some plain HTML content. Its content can be another form row.

Note: The form row must be ended with endFormRow() after creating its HTML content.

Parameters:
aLabelSpec - the row label.
anIconURL - a custom icon URL.
Since:
5.2.3

startFormRow

public void startFormRow(UIFormLabelSpec aLabelSpec,
                         UIFormRowIcon aFormRowIcon)
Starts a form row containing an icon, a label and some plain HTML content. Its content can be another form row.

Note: The form row must be ended with endFormRow() after creating its HTML content.

Parameters:
aLabelSpec - the row label.
aFormRowIcon - a form row icon.
Since:
5.2.3

newFormRow

public UIFormRow newFormRow()
Returns a new form row, set with an empty icon and an empty label.

See Also:
UIFormPaneWriter.newFormRow(com.orchestranetworks.schema.Path)

startFormRow

public void startFormRow(UIFormRow aFormRow)
Starts a form row by writing its icon and label according to the specified argument. The user input/display zone must be completed independently, it can be raw HTML content, a built-in component, or other form rows.

Note: The form row must be ended with endFormRow() after creating its HTML content.

Parameters:
aFormRow - the form row to be started.
Throws:
PathAccessException - if the specified row is based on an incorrect path; for instance, the path does not refer to an existing node or it is absolute and specifies a record node.
Since:
5.3.0

endFormRow

public void endFormRow()
Ends the form row previously started by a startFormRow.

startTableFormRow

public void startTableFormRow()
Starts a table of form rows. A table of form rows is composed of a first column displaying row labels with optional icons and a second column containing the input components. The main benefit is the optimization of the label column width.

A table of form rows contains only form rows added with startFormRow(UIFormLabelSpec). Adding anything else to the table can break the whole UI, and is thus not permitted.

Note: The table must be ended with endTableFormRow() after adding the form rows.

Since:
5.2.2
See Also:
startFormRow(UIFormLabelSpec)

endTableFormRow

public void endTableFormRow()
Ends a table of form rows previously started by startTableFormRow().

Since:
5.2.2
